channel.title: How do I make a compiler?
channel.description: It says for me to work in C++ i need to make a "Compiler" how do I do this?

item.title: How do I make a compiler?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

devcpp ships with an ancient version of MinGW but it’s not too hard to switch compiler. it’s a little bit buggy and inflexible though, don’t expect support for C++11.

Read full topic

why is everyone complaining about the activity of software? maybe it doesn’t need updating?
[/quote]

Doesn’t DevC++ use an archaic C++ compiler? Like a really old version of MinGW?[/quote]

I dont believe so. the point was. it worked a few months ago. i think it will work now. if it didnt, dont u think they’d thake the site down?

item.title: How do I make a compiler?
item.dc:creator: @Daginith Daginith
item.description:
@Daginith wrote:

[quote=“sp11k3t3ht3rd, post:15, topic:428352”][quote author=Daginith link=topic=531044.msg3881140#msg3881140 date=1326043704]

It says for me to work in C++ i need to make a “Compiler” how do I do this?

First off, c++ isnt compiled the same way as JAVA. Second, u need a compileing program. for linux use GCC (http://gcc.gnu.org/) and for windoes use BloodShead. (http://bloodshed.net/)
[/quote]

DevC++ hasn’t been updated since February 21, 2005. USE CODE::BLOCKS.

Plus I don’t think that he said anything implying that he thought C++ was compiled the same as Java[/quote]

lol i use linux, sorry. i used to use DevC++. im not too big into windows these days.

Read full topic

item.source: How do I make a compiler?

item.title: How do I make a compiler?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:7, topic:428352”]Nobody on these forums, nor MITB has the knowledge of making a compiler.[/quote]no, there are probably a fair few who can or have made a compiler (i’d know because i’ve written a basic assembler, which is effectively a very simplistic compiler for assembly language). it is fairly hard stuff (depends on where you want to take it), but writing a simple grammar for a simple language and compiling it down to unoptimised bytecode or machine code isn’t overly hard. compilers like javac and gcc are much more complex though, with various methods of optimisation, flow analysis, multiple architectural targets, etc. and they’ve had many experts working on them.

if you wanted to get started with writing compilers, buy ‘Compilers: Principles, Techniques, and Tools’ aka the dragon book. also read up on parsers, grammars and machine code (or bytecode if you want to target a vm like the JVM).

Read full topic
